H0.text: Gene is a structure that carries a single unit of hereditary information.

H1.text: Tissue is a structure that carries a single unit of hereditary information.

H2.text: A sex cell is a structure that carries a single unit of hereditary information.

H3.text: Pedigree chart is a structure that carries a single unit of hereditary information.

A4.text: According to Mendelian inheritance, variations in an organism's phenotype (observable physical and behavioral characteristics) are due in part to variations in its genotype (particular set of genes).
